result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason A. Cleveland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: MCJ with 45 days to start. EMP if Defendant qualifies.

DNA sample;

Defendant needs to provide prints and photos.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason A. Cleveland

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 2:40 pm 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Def appears in person with Atty Adam Fontana. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 

PLEA: Ct. 1 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: 10 days MCJ with NO days credit, with 45 days to start, and with EMP if def qualifies; DNA sample/surcharge; CC with 60 days to pay or set up payment plan. 
State notes def needs to provide prints and photo. 
COURT ORDERS def to provide prints and photo. 
Adj: 2:45 pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 6, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
